reviews.review_msg: I see a lot of people switching their reviews after grades were released. As someone who got an A+ in the course (solely due to the curve), I still think reviews should be based on the teaching capacity of the professor, not your individual grade. Lisa was a disorganized and rude professor, she overworked us and provided no help or resources.

Nice prof, kind but not very organized and heavy on sustainability.

No homework, 1 group paper (pick members wisely), and 2 textbooks. 

Concepts are easy but lots of self-learning. 

Tests are dense and tightly timed. 

Be direct when asking questions and ask follow-ups—she tends to go on tangents.
Final grade came out, and I did better than expected. Forgive me, Lisa. Perhaps I was too harsh.

I know there is a lot of negative comments about Lisa, but most of them came ahead of the final grades. I came out of the class with a newfound appreciation for sustainability reporting accounting. The problem is that this class is an intermediate managerial accounting course first, and I had trouble finding the synergies between the two concepts.

After seeing my grade I take back my previous 1 star. Lisa is coolios, just not the typical structure of an accounting course you'd expect. However, the difficulty of the content isn't heavy compared to other accounting courses. Usually I get Cs in accounting, but dropped an A- today... so seems like course is doable in the end! Practice & engage!

Lisa wasn't a bad prof, but the course was just not for me. She advised everyone to get Pearson (~$110) which I did, but wasn't that useful for the exams (both midterm and final). Better to study first using the handouts she gives and use free trial of Pearson. She mainly breezes through the slides and class activities rather managerial problems

It is clear that she is very passionate about what she teaches. However I think she needs to spend more time engaging students with accounting lessons rather than sustainability lessons. Exam would have been fair if we had 4-5 hours instead of 3, way too long of an exam for 3 hours.

I had 320 with Dennis and he was inspirational to pursue my degree in accounting. 

Lisa was not inspirational and is the reason I want to drop out of accounting.

One of the worst accounting profs I've had. Lectures focus on sustainability talk instead of actual course material. Practice questions are dumped at the end with no guidance, and the final tested the hardest concepts we were barely taught. Avoid at all costs.

Doesn't explain anything clearly, not even during office hours. Almost as if she doesn't know what she is talking about, she dodges questions and says to look at the textbook or class notes. Class notes don't exist and she doesn't provide solutions to practice problems. Exam was 3 hours + take home portion. No respect for students time or effort.
She is an excellent instructor. If you have questions, attend office hours; she explains everything clearly. To those with concerns, I'd suggest trying her office hours first.

Over emphasis on sustainability. You spend most of your time on group projects that are mainly about sustainability and spend less than a third of the class on managerial accounting concepts - all while the exams are 90% on managerial accounting that she barely goes over.

If you want to actually learn managerial accounting I'd skip her.

Incredibly frustrating professor that made the course a far worse time than big 4 busy season. Incredibly difficult exam that was impossible to finish in 3 hours. Always answered students with “see textbook” or something ridiculous. If you value your time, sanity, effort, avoid this professor AT ALL COSTS. Also, did not provide answers to questions

This professor was an absolute nightmare, it was so bad, that I felt the need to make this review. Incredibly long and impossible final exam that was no where NEAR fair. Answered students with “see textbook” and provided no solutions to practice questions. DO NOT TAKE, if you value your sanity and grades. Was a better time in PwC during busy season

She obviously cares a lot about accounting, but she teaches the class terribly. Tries to make everything into a game that provides no learning value. Provides us with complex practice problems but no answers and refuses to explain them. The final exam felt like a prank, the only people who left early were ones who gave up and didnt finish.

Sure, Lisa was disorganized, took forever to grade, was inconsistent with marking, and wouldn't post solutions. But she's a first-year prof, and most of you wouldn't understand how tough that is—especially teaching a class with a campus celeb. Tom Brady was a 6th-round pick and struggled early. I think Lisa could be the next GOAT of SFU profs.

Very organized with clear instructions for all assignments. The workload is fair and matches course goals. Though the content is challenging, she supports learning by posting class solutions. Expectations are clear, and grading is consistent with no surprises. She makes the course structured and easy to follow.
Really good she teaches us how to study and the importance of working with your peers

Hardest final exam I have ever done. Doesn't help that she didn't explain any topics, or provide any answers to practice problems. Exam was way too long for a 3hour exam, so many people didn't finish, and she provided little to no support leading up to it. Told us to ask her questions and her responses wer "check your notes" or check the textbook

This is the first time I haven't finished an exam. Final was impossible to do in 3hrs and even included a take-home section. Haven't taken 312 and was put at a major disadvantage when she jumped into capital budgeting Qs w/o explaining (most important topic btw). Too many projects, 30-40 min seminars were stupid and ate up valuable class time 0/10

Final exam was insane. 4 just brutally lengthy questions, including one where the question itself was 4 pages long, and the required calculations/answers were split up into ~20 parts. Majority of people didn't even finish. She yelled at a student for asking to use the bathroom. Would be surprised if the average was above 40%.

Nice lady, but terrible prof. Instead of teaching the class normally, she decides to turn everything into an interactive adventure game, which results in no learning. Tons of assignments, very extensive projects, and exams are brutal to study for. Spends 99% of the time talking about sustainability even though it makes up 5-10% of the exam.

I never thought I'd be posting on one of these, but what this prof needs is to create a sustainability podcast or something to an audience of 50-100 viewers rather than her 50-100 accounting students. 5 years in this program and by far this was the most horrific experience yet. Brutal.

Unorganized, and does not grade our work on time. Has made the exams harder than she said they would be, and was not helpful in terms of exam prep. The course concepts are not that hard with the work, but the exams do not reflect what's learned.

Absolutely worst prof in Beedie. We've covered 0 topic in class, solved 0 problems, only talked about sustainability. No solutions to practice questions. Literally nobody in class is following the course. Avoid at all costs
Not a good idea....

The worst Prof I've come across ever. She teaches nothing related to the course or the exams in class. Does not give out solutions to practice questions as she wants you to figure out the correct answers by working with your peers, but would you ever know if the answer is correct... Talked more about sustainability than accounting.
DO NOT TAKE HER!!!

Nice person, genuinely an awful professor though. Heavy workload, teaches ESG more than accounting, completely disorganized, and not helpful at all. Will spend 5-10 mins giving you an answer to a completely unrelated question from the one you asked, that will leave you more confused. Very unclear about expectations for assignments/papers/tests etc

Dude this prof hasn't taught me anything. For our last chapter (she said super important for the final) all she provided was an excel question and doesn't explain how to get the answers and the logic behind it ( she said any practice we do for this question will be nothing compared to the exam difficulty). Better off learning from Khan academy

She is very passionate about accounting, but her teaching has to be the worst teaching I've ever encountered. Classes are pretty much useless and off-topic, weekly assignments that will have you consumed and overwhelmed, and hard to understand practice problems that only leaves you more confused. Lisa should try a traditional teaching style.

Lisa is very disorganized. Besides, the course load is unreasonably heavy: seminar, discussions, term paper, homework, tests, and participation. Does not teach Managerial accounting, therefore it is confusing what to expect from the final. Need major improvement.
talks for hours about nothing

Extremely disorganized - vague instructions for assignments. Heavy workload for no reason. Content is easy but she makes it hard to practice (doesn't post in-class solutions out of fear of someone leaking them). Seems like she doesn't even know what she wants students to do. Every deliverable grading incident is a unpredictable surprise

So disorganized. She cares and is nice but there is way too much going on. Would not recommend. Rather than teach and assign practice problems, she gives time to do problems in class (does not really provide solutions) and expects students to learn on their own.

Lisa is a subpar accounting professor; she would be my fifth accounting professor I have had, and by far the one with the least pleasant experience with her. First, her lectures are slow and unorganized; she gets very frustrated very easily when lectures aren't going her way (probably cause unorganized). Tests are fair but that's it.
